Use your dragon in combat. But beware, he could be hurt or even die.
Use your dragon in siege. But beware, he could be hurt or even die.

You and [your_dragon.GetFullName] enter the battlefield. The enemy holds his breath as [your_dragon.GetFullName] flooded the sky and the ground with fire. The opposing soldiers merge with their armor or flee from the flying inferno. Nobody awakens the dragon with impunity!

The enemy has entrenched himself in this holding. But castles are not dragon-proof! The garrison sees their misfortunes plunging down as they see the flames of [your_dragon.GetFullName] and merge alive with the castle's stones.
You have to be commander in a battle. Your dragon must also be ready to fight.
You have to be commander and attacker in a siege. Your dragon must also be ready to fight.
This is a dragon. Dragons are monstrous fire-breathing scaly creatures. They are the symbol of power of the Freehold.
This is a dragon rider. He has mastered taming a dragon and now flies on his back. He can even use him as the ultimate weapon in battle.
The dragon is wounded giving him a disadvantage in combat. However, now it is easier to tame him.
The dragon is maimed giving him a major disadvantage in combat. However, now it is much easier to tame him.
This dragon is strong. He grows faster and is superior to his fows in combat.
This dragon is weak. He grows slower and is inferior to his fows in combat.
This dragon is slothful. He wants to stay at his lair and avoids unnecessary actionsmaking it easier to tame him.
